intro: Barteria nigritana var. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered barteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
